project.teaser: Climate change will require concerted innovative ideas and actions at the local/regional level. A sustainable European bioeconomy will not only ensure the protection of the environment and biodiversity, but will also drive the renewal of European industries, the modernisation...
project.objective:
Climate change will require concerted innovative ideas and actions at the local/regional level. A sustainable European bioeconomy will not only ensure the protection of the environment and biodiversity, but will also drive the renewal of European industries, the modernisation of primary production systems and lead to the creation of jobs, particularly in rural areas, through the active participation of all regional stakeholders in their local bioeconomies.
RuralBioUp project will strengthen the cooperation among regional key actors and knowledge holders, empowering them to establish an inclusive and long-lasting ecosystem (the RuralBioUp Regional Hubs) to support the mainstreaming of bio-based business models in rural areas. In particular, RuralBioUp will establish 9 Regional Hubs (30 stakeholders per Hub) in 6 EU countries, that will co-design and implement 9 Action Plans on 18 value chains. Regional Hubs will be empowered by RuralBioUp's partners with mentoring, coaching and training activities in the implementation of their Action Plans.
Thanks to this, at least (a.l.) 1.000 innovators will be supported (through networking events and study visits) and a.l. 50 new collaborations fostered (e.g. partnership agreements between companies and/or farmers, solutions funded, etc.) to adopt small-scale bio-based solutions in rural areas. The project will leverage synergies between existing EU networks (EuBioNet, BioEast, etc.), clusters, and regional organisations and will build upon previous research results (Power4Bio, BE-RURAL, Enabling, Transition2Bio, Biovoices, etc.) by integrating and extending the existing knowledge and data in order to propose different rural business models and new bio-based value chains in the targeted regions, through the realisation of a digital tool (the RuralBioUp One-Stop-Shop) supporting regional actors to take science-based and informed decisions.
project.title: Empowering EU Rural Regions to scale-Up and adopt small-scale Bio-based solutions: the transition towards a sustainable, regenerative, inclusive and just circular bioeconomy
project.keywords: rural development, bio-based solutions market uptake, stakeholder engagement, multi-actor approach, rural areas empowerment, open innovation

article.title: Tackling climate change in rural hubs

result.title: D6.1 Plan for the dissemination and exploitation including communication activities
result.description: Report explaining envisaged tools and channels for communication, target groups with their drivers and barriers to communication, value propositions of RuralBioUp project, Consortium channels, networks to be leveraged and pathways to exploitation. Linked to task 6.1.

result.title: D4.1 RuralBioUp portfolio of services
result.description: Report on the results of mapping the practical knowledge and training resources developed by other projects, packaged into portfolio of supportive services (Toolkit, coaching, mentoring training modules and other information/resources) to be used for implementing supporting activities within Regional Hubs. This deliverable is linked to Task 4.1

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - RuralBioUp (Empowering EU Rural Regions to scale-Up and adopt small-scale Bio-based solutions: the transition towards a sustainable, regenerative, inclusive and just circular bioeconomy)
result.teaser: RuralBioUp main objective is to support innovators to scale-up inclusive and small-scale biobased solutions in rural areas, through the creation of a favourable ecosystem to be maintained within the empowered regions and transferred to other ones, in order to contribute to...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: "D3.1 Handbook ""How to build a RuralBioUp Regional Hub"""
result.description: This deliverable creates guidelines for Regional Facilitators and Hub Contact Points. It will compile information on how to implement a co-creation process engaging local stakeholders to identify, improve and adopt innovative bio-based business models.

result.title: D2.1 RuralBioUp Handbook for data mapping and assessment
result.description: D2.1 RuralBioUp Handbook for data mapping and assessment: template to ease the collection of existing data and knowledge made available by previous EU projects and research results. The template will ensure the uniformity of information and data to be collected in T2.2, in order to ease their comparison, clustering and harmonisation within the RuralBioUp One-Stop Shop tool. This deliverable is linked to task 2.1.

result.title: D2.4 RuralBioUp Dataset
result.description: D2.3 RuralBioUp Dataset: dataset, developed according to the technical requirement needed for the Matching Tool, where the data collected in the different subtasks of Task 2.2 will be harmonised, compared and matched in a matrix.

result.title: D1.2 Data Management Plan1
result.description: The Plan provides recommendations for Data and Management. This document serves as a guide for all partners to provide guidelines about how to manage data. It includes a detailed Project Management Plan.

result.title: D6.2 Mid term Report on dissemination and communication activities
result.description: Report on dissemination and communication activities implemented from M1 to M18. Linked to Task 6.2.

result.title: D1.1 Management & Quality Plan
result.description: The Project Management and Quality Plan will enclose all the required information needed to adopt smooth and efficient management of the project from the administrative and budgetary points of view. Through the revision of project progresses and reports to the EC the Management and Quality Plan will be implemented to all project procedures (data, reporting, dissemination and communication activities, etc.) in order to ensure compliance with quality standards (ISO 9001 and 14001).

result.title: D3.2 RuralBioUp Regional Hubs' Actions Plan
result.description: D3.2. is the outcome of T3.2., it summarizes Action Plans developed for each Regional Hub and provides guidelines for stakeholders' engagement activities, training and events for each Regional HUB and also instructions for the structure discussion of bio-based solutions.

category.title: innovation management
category.displayCode: /social sciences/economics and business/business and management/innovation management

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
